snippet: Hundreds of people were evacuated from the last rebel-held pocket of the central Syrian city devastated by years of fighting and blockades.
abstract: World leaders are hopeful local cease-fire in Syrian city of Homs, which allowed evacuations of both rebel fighters and civilians, as well as food deliveries, portends potential large-scale solution; critics say Syrian government, which asserts truce will return province to its full control, gains most in arrangement.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of people were evacuated from the last rebel-held pocket of the central Syrian city devastated by years of fighting and blockades.

headline.main: Hundreds Evacuated From Rebel Foothold in Homs Under Cease-Fire
headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire in Syria City Allows Food and Evacuations
